content: We are using FHIR validator to validate our patient profile which is based on ISO639-3 three letter codes. It seems that validator allows custom 3 letter codes code system and value set binding although default binding is bcp47. Also language binding says "preferred to common languages but limited to AllLanguages". Does "limited to" mean that the system must be bcp47? If so, it looks that validator does not validate it this way. Can someone provide some clarification on this?

The system must be bcp47. bcp47 only allows 3-letter codes where there's no 2-letter equivalent. If the validator isn't enforcing this properly, please log a Git issues against the validator or submit a FHIR change request with a sample instance and the validation results (also make sure you're using the most recent version of the validator).
Much appreciated Lloyd! We'll try again with the latest validator and follow up as suggested.
